review: I bought the Fire TV on sale after my Roku died without much warning. I read a bit on the comparisons, but I've been in no way dissatisfied with the Roku's performance. The main selling point for me was the Prime integration and the overall specifications of the Fire TV. The fact that it's Android based also helped somewhat, as I expected to see a lot of existing apps appearing to fill any voids.My first unit was DOA. Customer Service was extremely responsive and helpful, but it took a week to get a replacement unit. The second unit has been fine, setup was easy and getting up and running took almost no time.I have noticed a lot of choppiness in video playback, at one point it became so bad I had to do a soft reset. I am also disappointed in the small number of apps and the limited way to actually find useful ones. Overall the unit still just seems like a new platform, I certainly hope that over the next few months it will become stable and more robust, the potential is definitely there. Really looking for HBO GO, too!
